snippet: The Ohio Court of Appeals ordered a new trial over a claim that commercial truck dealers were overcharged by the company for more than a decade.
abstract: Ohio Court of Appeals overturns 2011 ruling ordering the Ford Motor Company to pay $2 billion to commercial truck dealers who claim they were overcharged by the company for more than a decade. (M)
lead_paragraph: DETROIT -- The Ohio Court of Appeals has overturned a judge's ruling last year that the Ford Motor Company must pay $2 billion to commercial truck dealers who claim they were overcharged by the company for more than a decade, Ford said Friday. The appellate court ordered a new trial for the class-action case, ruling that Judge Peter J. Corrigan of Cuyahoga County erred in excluding evidence presented by Ford.

headline.main: Court Reverses $2 Billion Ruling Against Ford and Orders a New Trial
